mn114:2.1: What Should and Should Not Be Cultivated
mn114:3.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn114:3.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
mn114:3.7: “Mendicants, I will teach you an exposition of the teaching on what should and should not be cultivated.
mn114:3.8: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
mn114:4.1: “I say that there are two kinds of bodily behavior:
mn114:4.2: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.3: And each of these is a kind of behavior.
mn114:4.4: I say that there are two kinds of verbal behavior:
mn114:4.5: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.6: And each of these is a kind of behavior.
mn114:4.7: I say that there are two kinds of mental behavior:
mn114:4.8: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.9: And each of these is a kind of behavior.
mn114:4.10: I say that there are two ways of giving rise to a thought:
mn114:4.11: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.12: And each of these is a way of giving rise to a thought.
mn114:4.13: I say that there are two ways of acquiring perception:
mn114:4.14: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.15: And each of these is a way of acquiring perception.
mn114:4.16: I say that there are two ways of acquiring views:
mn114:4.17: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.18: And each of these is a way of acquiring views.
mn114:4.19: I say that there are two ways of acquiring a new life-form:
mn114:4.20: that which you should cultivate, and that which you should not cultivate.
mn114:4.21: And each of these is a way of acquiring a new life-form.”
